p: The origin of the large cell-to-cell heterogeneity in virus infections is still not fully understood [ 29, 30, 31, 32, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39, 40, 43, 44]. We conducted single-cell analysis of IAV replication and reveal an association of DIP co-infections and single-cell progeny virus yields. Thus, differences in the content of DI vRNAs and DI mRNAs (observed between individual cells) may well contribute to the large cell-to-cell heterogeneity in virus release. However, we also found a few exceptions from this observation, which may be explained by scarcely occurring DI vRNAs, which cannot interfere with standard virus (STV) replication for unknown reasons [ 11, 25], or more likely, the presence of additional factors that can influence single-cell virus yield.
